intro: Columellea biennis, commonly known as the two-yeared columella, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate climates and has lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. It produces showy yellow flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
